text:
can i make delete and yank use different registers in nvim 

Yes, you can configure Vim/Neovim to use different registers for delete and yank operations. Here are a few ways to do it:

1. Using your init.vim or init.lua to remap delete operations to use a specific register:

```vim
" For init.vim
" Make delete operations use the "d register
nnoremap d "dd
vnoremap d "dd
nnoremap D "dD
nnoremap dd "ddd

" Yanking will still use the default unnamed register
```

Or in Lua:

```lua
-- For init.lua
vim.keymap.set('n', 'd', '"dd')
vim.keymap.set('v', 'd', '"dd')
vim.keymap.set('n', 'D', '"dD')
vim.keymap.set('n', 'dd', '"ddd')
```

2. Another approach is to make all delete operations use the black hole register (_) and keep yanks in the default register:

```vim
" For init.vim
nnoremap d "_d
vnoremap d "_d
nnoremap D "_D
nnoremap dd "_dd
```

Or in Lua:

```lua
-- For init.lua
vim.keymap.set('n', 'd', '"_d')
vim.keymap.set('v', 'd', '"_d')
vim.keymap.set('n', 'D', '"_D')
vim.keymap.set('n', 'dd', '"_dd')
```

3. You can also use the 'clipboard' option to control where yanks go:

```vim
" Send yanks to system clipboard
set clipboard+=unnamed
```

Or in Lua:

```lua
vim.opt.clipboard:append('unnamed')
```

Choose the approach that best fits your workflow. The second option (using the black hole register) is popular because it prevents deleted text from overwriting your yanked text.
